$\gdef\xb{x\textrm{b}}$ # $\xb \textrm{ } \cdot \textrm{ the } anything \textrm{ book}$ ***(sorry, this document a barely-started work in progress)*** $\xb$ is a versatile notebook that can become anything: a web page, a report, a technical document or even an interactive application! All this within a Web-standards-based platform. See the source code here: https://github.com/ed-puckett/xb ### Goals - zero install - portable - durable - typeset math, etc - executable content - standalone (not quite: requires static server) --- - cell element - associated with xb: XbManager - attributes: data-type, data-active - output element - created by OutputContext.create_cell_output() - attributes: data-source-media-type, data-source-element - css class: xb-cell-output - OutputContext (ocx) - associated with xb: XbManager - associated with element: Element - XbManager.singleton - controls data-cell-view attribute on document.documentElement (:root) - invoke_renderer() and invoke_renderer_for_type() methods

\gdef\xb{x\textrm{b}}

xb ⋅ the anything book\xb \textrm{ } \cdot \textrm{ the } anything \textrm{ book}xb ⋅ the anything book

(sorry, this document a barely-started work in progress)

xb\xbxb is a versatile notebook that can become anything: a web page, a report, a technical document or even an interactive application!

All this within a Web-standards-based platform.

See the source code here: https://github.com/ed-puckett/xb

Goals

  • zero install
  • portable
  • durable
  • typeset math, etc
  • executable content
  • standalone (not quite: requires static server)
  • cell element
    • associated with xb: XbManager
    • attributes: data-type, data-active
  • output element
    • created by OutputContext.create_cell_output()
    • attributes: data-source-media-type, data-source-element
    • css class: xb-cell-output
  • OutputContext (ocx)
    • associated with xb: XbManager
    • associated with element: Element
  • XbManager.singleton
    • controls data-cell-view attribute on document.documentElement (:root)
    • invoke_renderer() and invoke_renderer_for_type() methods
